docs.snippet: For years, John Junker enjoyed the prestige of running the Fiesta Bowl organization, pulling in a six-figure salary, rubbing elbows with powerful people and taking advantage of the perks of the job such as spending $33,000 in bowl money on his bir...
docs.lead_paragraph: For years, John Junker enjoyed the prestige of running the Fiesta Bowl organization, pulling in a six-figure salary, rubbing elbows with powerful people and taking advantage of the perks of the job such as spending $33,000 in bowl money on his birthday bash.

headline.main: Ex-CEO of Fiesta Bowl Gets 8 Months in Prison

docs.snippet: The Big East could have used a semifinal showdown between Seton Hall and St. John’s....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Big East could have used a semifinal showdown between Seton Hall and St. John’s.
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On College Basketball column holds that The Big East could have used a semifinal showdown between Seton Hall and St. John’s at Madison Square Garden; says from a New York state of mind, the tournament feels inescapably slimmed down and less substantial without the departed powerhouses that normally help fill the Garden this time of year.

headline.main: Big East Tournament at the Garden Lacks New York Flavor
headline.print_headline: New York Flavor Lacking at Garden

docs.snippet: Uli Hoeness said on Friday he would accept a 3-1/2-year prison term for evading 27 million euros (22.5 million pounds) in taxes and resigned as president and chairman of Bayern Munich, the club he made into one of the world's most successful footb...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uli Hoeness said on Friday he would accept a 3-1/2-year prison term for evading 27 million euros (22.5 million pounds) in taxes and resigned as president and chairman of Bayern Munich, the club he made into one of the world's most successful football dynasties.

headline.main: Hoeness Quits Bayern, Accepts Jail Term for Tax Evasion
headline.print_headline: Hoeness Quits Bayern, Accepts Jail Term for Tax Evasion

docs.snippet: Uli Hoeness said on Friday he would accept a 3-1/2-year prison term for evading 27 million euros ($37.6 million) in taxes and resigned as president and chairman of Bayern Munich, the club he made into one of the world's most successful football dy...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uli Hoeness said on Friday he would accept a 3-1/2-year prison term for evading 27 million euros ($37.6 million) in taxes and resigned as president and chairman of Bayern Munich, the club he made into one of the world's most successful football dynasties.

headline.main: Bayern Munich Boss Quits, Accepts Jail Term
headline.print_headline: Bayern Munich Boss Quits, Accepts Jail Term

docs.snippet: Dan Hurley, the coach at Rhode Island, is the son of the Hall of Fame coach Bob Hurley Sr., and one of his assistants, Luke Murray, is the son of the actor Bill Murray....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dan Hurley, the coach at Rhode Island, is the son of the Hall of Fame coach Bob Hurley Sr., and one of his assistants, Luke Murray, is the son of the actor Bill Murray.
docs.abstract: Rhode Island coach Dan Hurley is the son of Basketball Hall of Fame coach Bob Hurley Sr, and one of his assistants, Luke Murray, is the son of actor Bill Murray; two have toiled for years to prove their worth as professionals in the shadows of famous fathers; they arrived at Rhode Island as rising stars, but success has not come as quickly as expected.

headline.main: Two Coaches Born Into Fame Earn Respect Themselves
headline.print_headline: 2 Coaches Born Into Fame Earn Respect Themselves

docs.snippet: Shannon Szabados, who won an Olympic gold medal for Canada, is expected to become the first woman to play in the Southern Professional Hockey League....
docs.lead_paragraph: Shannon Szabados, who won an Olympic gold medal for Canada, is expected to become the first woman to play in the Southern Professional Hockey League.
docs.abstract: Goaltender Shannon Szabados, who won an Olympic gold medal for Canada's ice hockey team at the Sochi Games, is making her pro debut and will become the first woman to play in the Southern Professional Hockey League; circumstances have steered Szabados straight into the crossfire of the gender wars; there is no professional hockey league for women that pays a livable wage, so the best female players have limited options.
